page.title: 11MULTI-RELIGIOUS COMMUNITY
page.content: Although the vast majority of the area has a religious base that is similar to most parts of the country, there is one section that can be truely termed multi-religious in nature. Mosques, chapels, churches and temples all serve the local community. The newest Mosque, the Shahjalal Mosque serving the Bangladeshi community was opened with due ceremony on the 5th May 1985. Originally the mosque was two private houses, and with lots of hard work these were knocked into one large building. Despite a few problems the mosque was finally ready for the official opening ceremony. Local dignitaries were invited, plus the High Commissioner for Bangladesh, as well as religious leaders of the local community.
